Word of the Day for Tuesday October 15, 2002 soporific \sop-uh-RIF-ik; soh-puh-\, adjective: 1. Causing sleep; tending to cause sleep. 2. Of, relating to, or characterized by sleepiness or lethargy.
noun: A medicine, drug, plant, or other agent that has the quality of inducing sleep; a narcotic.
They were almost an hour behind in their daily schedule, and both women looked tired after a soporific afternoon of three executive meetings. --Gabriel Garcia Marquez, News of a Kidnapping
하루일과표에서 한시간이나 뒤쳐진데다가 졸린오후에 잡혀진 3개의 이사진 회의땜에 두 여인 다 지쳐보였다.
Soporific is from French soporifique, from Latin sopor, "a heavy sleep" + -ficus, "-fic," from facere, "to make."
Yahoo Dictionary... sop·o·rif·ic － adj. 졸리게 하는, 최면(성)의; 졸린 듯한; 졸리운(sleepy, drowsy). －n. 최면제, 수면제; 마취제(narcotic).
post.title: soporific
